etymology.description: semantic: 走(走) (zǒu, "run") + phonetic: 召(召) (zhào, "summon") = running to summon or surpass -> exceed
etymology.interpretation: The character 超 (chāo) combines the concept of running 走(走) (zǒu, "run") with a sound from 召(召) (zhào, "summon"), implying going beyond or surpassing norms or limits, just like running might surpass a walking pace.

examples.chinese: 他的成绩超出班级平均水平(他的成績超出班級平均水平)。
examples.pinyin: tā de chéngjì chāochū bānjí píngjūn shuǐpíng
examples.english: His performance exceeds the class average.

examples.chinese: 他在比赛中超越对手(他在比賽中超越對手)，赢得冠军(贏得冠軍)。
examples.pinyin: tā zài bǐsài zhōng chāoyuè duìshǒu, yíngdé guànjūn
examples.english: He surpassed his opponents in the competition and won the championship.

examples.chinese: 他的热情超乎想象(他的熱情超乎想象)，鼓舞了全体队员(鼓舞了全體隊員)。
examples.pinyin: tā de rèqíng chāohū xiǎngxiàng, gǔwǔ le quántǐ duìyuán
examples.english: His enthusiasm exceeded all expectations and inspired the whole team.
